---
title: 'serve-unbound'
description: "Serve an unbound expression via Flight"
---

Serve a built expression after replacing one node with an unbound table. Clients stream Arrow IPC to the server to supply that table at request time. Use this when one input is dynamic (e.g. user-provided data) and the rest of the pipeline is fixed.

## Usage

Pass a build path and optional node selector (hash or tag) and host/port.

```bash
xorq serve-unbound <build_path> [OPTIONS]
```

## Arguments

The build to serve.

| Argument | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `build_path` | Build target: alias, entry ID, build ID, or path to the build directory |

## Options

Node to unbind, host, port, and cache.

| Option | Default | Description |
|--------|---------|-------------|
| `--to_unbind_hash` | | Hash of the node to replace with unbound input |
| `--to_unbind_tag` | | Tag of the node to replace (alternative to hash) |
| `--typ` | | Type of the node to unbind |
| `--host` | `localhost` | Host to bind the Flight server |
| `--port` | (random) | Port to bind |
| `--prometheus-port` | (disabled) | Port for Prometheus metrics |
| `--cache-dir` | (system cache) | Directory for parquet cache files |

If neither `--to_unbind_hash` nor `--to_unbind_tag` is set, the command may infer the node; specifying one is recommended for determinism.

## Examples

Serve with an explicit node hash or by tag.

```bash
xorq serve-unbound builds/7061dd65ff3c --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8001 --to_unbind_hash b2370a29c19df8e1e639c63252dacd0e
xorq serve-unbound builds/7061dd65ff3c --to_unbind_tag source_input
```
